Package gui

Class GUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • gui.GUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class GUI
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    An instance is a GUI for the game. Run this file as a Java application to test the project.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main program.

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo​(Node dest)
        Move the player on the GUI to destination dest. Note : This blocks until the player has moved. Precondition : dest is adjacent to the player's current location

      • updateBonus

        public void updateBonus​(double bonus)
        Update the bonus multiplier as displayed by the GUI by bonus

      • updateCoins

        public void updateCoins​(int coins,
                        int score)
        Update the number of coins picked up as displayed on the GUI.
        Parameters:
        coins - the number of coins to be displayed
        score - the player's current score

      • updateTimeRemaining

        public void updateTimeRemaining​(int timeRemaining)
        Update the time remaining as displayed on the GUI. timeRemaining is the time remaining before the cave collapses

      • updateCavern

        public void updateCavern​(Cavern c,
                         int numStepsRemaining)
        What is the specification?

      • setLighting

        public void setLighting​(boolean light)
        Set the cavern to be all light or all dark, depending on light.

      • getIcon

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getIcon​(Tile.Type type)
        Return an image representing tile type.

      • getGoldIcon

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getGoldIcon​(Node n)
        Return an icon for the gold on tile n, or null otherwise.

      • selectNode

        public void selectNode​(Node n)
        Select node n on the GUI. This displays information on that node's panel on the screen to the right.

      • displayError

        public void displayError​(java.lang.String e)
        Display error e to the player.
